intro: Cardamine impatiens var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed watercress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically heart-shaped. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. This variety is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as stream banks and woodland edges.
